This file contains the control functions for exporting your inventory.

Public Functions

These are functions that everyone can access.

.
add_inventory_container
void add_inventory_container(object cont)
This method adds a container to the list of registered containers. A registered container will be used to enhance the inventory of the current container. This will only be used with find_match inventory items. The item *must* be contained inside this object to be added. When checking only visible added objects will have their inventory added.

Parameters:
cont - the new container to add
See also:
find_inv_match() and remove_inventory_container()
query_can_export_inventory
int query_can_export_inventory()
This method returns if the container will export its inventory.

Returns:
1 if the container does export its inventory, 0 if not
See also:
add_inventory_container(), query_can_export_inventory(), reset_can_export_inventory() and set_can_export_inventory()
remove_inventory_container
void remove_inventory_container(object cont)
This method removes a container to the list of registered containers. A registered container will be used to enhance the inventory of the current container. This will only be used with find_match inventory items.

Parameters:
cont - the new container to add
See also:
find_inv_match() and add_inventory_container()
reset_can_export_inventory
void reset_can_export_inventory()
This method disables the object from exporting its inventory.

See also:
set_can_export_inventory(), query_can_export_inventory() and add_inventory_container()
set_can_export_inventory
void set_can_export_inventory()
This method allows the objects inside it (which are registered) to export their invetories as well. You do not want to be able to do this with player or living objects (for instance). The default value for this is reset()

See also:
add_inventory_container(), query_can_export_inventory() and reset_can_export_inventory()

Protected Functions

These are functions that only objects inheriting the class can access.

find_expanded_inv_match
object * find_expanded_inv_match(string words,
object looker,
object * things)
This method is not designed to be called from outside the object itself. It returns the list of objects able to be matched that are container in containers in the container. The third parameter is the set of objects the container must appear in to be used. This has to be handled sperately so thet the plural matchin does not return the ones deep inside your containers.

Parameters:
words - the words which were matched with
looker - the person doing the matching
things - the current list of things matched.
